t: Mark 7
Then*p came together unto him the Pharisees, and certain of the scribes, which came from Jerusalem.
And*p when they saw some of his disciples eat bread with defiled, that is to say, with unwashen, hands, they found fault.
For*p the Pharisees, and all the Jews, except they wash their hands oft, eat not, holding the tradition of the elders.

And*p when they come from the market, except they wash, they eat not. And many other things there be, which they have received to hold, as the washing of cups, and pots, brasen vessels, and of tables.
Then*p the Pharisees and scribes asked him, Why walk not thy disciples according to the tradition of the elders, but eat bread with unwashen hands?

He*p answered and said unto them, Well*r hath*r Esaias*r prophesied*r of*r you*r hypocrites,*r as*r it*r is*r written,*r This*r people*r honoureth*r me*r with*r their*r lips,*r but*r their*r heart*r is*r far*r from*r me.*r
Howbeit*rp in*r vain*r do*r they*r worship*r me,*r teaching*r for*r doctrines*r the*r commandments*r of*r men.*r
For*rp laying*r aside*r the*r commandment*r of*r God,*r ye*r hold*r the*r tradition*r of*r men,*r as*r the*r washing*r of*r pots*r and*r cups:*r and*r many*r other*r such*r like*r things*r ye*r do.*r
And*p he said unto them, Full*r well*r ye*r reject*r the*r commandment*r of*r God,*r that*r ye*r may*r keep*r your*r own*r tradition.*r
For*rp Moses*r said,*r Honour*r thy*r father*r and*r thy*r mother;*r and,*r Whoso*r curseth*r father*r or*r mother,*r let*r him*r die*r the*r death:*r

But*rp ye*r say,*r If*r a*r man*r shall*r say*r to*r his*r father*r or*r mother,*r It*r is*r Corban,*r that*r is*r to*r say,*r a*r gift,*r by*r whatsoever*r thou*r mightest*r be*r profited*r by*r me;*r he*r shall*r be*r free.*r
And*rp ye*r suffer*r him*r no*r more*r to*r do*r ought*r for*r his*r father*r or*r his*r mother;*r
Making*rp the*r word*r of*r God*r of*r none*r effect*r through*r your*r tradition,*r which*r ye*r have*r delivered:*r and*r many*r such*r like*r things*r do*r ye.*r
And*p when he had called all the people unto him, he said unto them, Hearken*r unto*r me*r every*r one*r of*r you,*r and*r understand:*r

There*rp is*r nothing*r from*r without*r a*r man,*r that*r entering*r into*r him*r can*r defile*r him:*r but*r the*r things*r which*r come*r out*r of*r him,*r those*r are*r they*r that*r defile*r the*r man.*r
If*rp any*r man*r have*r ears*r to*r hear,*r let*r him*r hear.*r
And*p when he was entered into the house from the people, his disciples asked him concerning the parable.

And*p he saith unto them, Are*r ye*r so*r without*r understanding*r also?*r Do*r ye*r not*r perceive,*r that*r whatsoever*r thing*r from*r without*r entereth*r into*r the*r man,*r it*r cannot*r defile*r him;*r
Because*rp it*r entereth*r not*r into*r his*r heart,*r but*r into*r the*r belly,*r and*r goeth*r out*r into*r the*r draught,*r purging*r all*r meats?*r
And*p he said, That*r which*r cometh*r out*r of*r the*r man,*r that*r defileth*r the*r man.*r
For*rp from*r within,*r out*r of*r the*r heart*r of*r men,*r proceed*r evil*r thoughts,*r adulteries,*r fornications,*r murders,*r
Thefts,*rp covetousness,*r wickedness,*r deceit,*r lasciviousness,*r an*r evil*r eye,*r blasphemy,*r pride,*r foolishness:*r
All*rp these*r evil*r things*r come*r from*r within,*r and*r defile*r the*r man.*r
And*p from thence he arose, and went into the borders of Tyre and Sidon, and entered into an house, and would have no man know it: but he could not be hid.
For*p a certain woman, whose young daughter had an unclean spirit, heard of him, and came and fell at his feet:
The*p woman was a Greek, a Syrophenician by nation; and she besought him that he would cast forth the devil out of her daughter.
But*p Jesus said unto her, Let*r the*r children*r first*r be*r filled:*r for*r it*r is*r not*r meet*r to*r take*r the*r children's*r bread,*r and*r to*r cast*r it*r unto*r the*r dogs.*r
And*p she answered and said unto him, Yes, Lord: yet the dogs under the table eat of the children's crumbs.
And*p he said unto her, For*r this*r saying*r go*r thy*r way;*r the*r devil*r is*r gone*r out*r of*r thy*r daughter.*r
And*p when she was come to her house, she found the devil gone out, and her daughter laid upon the bed.
And*p again, departing from the coasts of Tyre and Sidon, he came unto the sea of Galilee, through the midst of the coasts of Decapolis.
And*p they bring unto him one that was deaf, and had an impediment in his speech; and they beseech him to put his hand upon him.
And*p he took him aside from the multitude, and put his fingers into his ears, and he spit, and touched his tongue;
And*p looking up to heaven, he sighed, and saith unto him, Ephphatha,*r that is, Be*r opened.*r
And*p straightway his ears were opened, and the string of his tongue was loosed, and he spake plain.
And*p he charged them that they should tell no man: but the more he charged them, so much the more a great deal they published it;
And*p were beyond measure astonished, saying, He hath done all things well: he maketh both the deaf to hear, and the dumb to speak.
